page.title: 05Transport. Middleton.
page.content: The area is traversed from West to East by the{A47}trunk road which is the main route from the Midlands to Great Yarmouth. It is heavily used but is single carriageway although there are campaigns currently to have it enlarged to dual carriageway. The A47 passes through the middle of Middleton with a 40 m.p.h. speed limit.Crossing the road can be a real problem for the villagers. { Buses}are few and mainly confined to the main road. North Runcton people have at least a half mile walk to the bus route. Old people that we spoke to said that they wished there were more buses. Most people living in the villages rely upon{private cars}for transport. There are real trsansport difficulties for children and old people.
